result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy M. Rutkowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 11:46am [mo]
Defendant Jeremy M. Rutkowski in court with Attorney Daniel E. Olsen.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of "NO CONTEST" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Count #2.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Rutkowski

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:

--complete anger management counseling
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no acts or threats of violence towards anyone
--no contact with Eddie Hudson
--100 hours of community service
--any counseling agent deems appropriate
--to pay statutory costs

Days credit for time already served:  0  days

The Court orders Mr. Rutkowski to provide a DNA sample.
Felony Firearm and Voting prohibition warnings given.
recess: 12:16pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 4, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Case called at 9:28am [mo]
Defendant Jeremy M. Rutkowski in court with Attorney Daniel E. Olsen.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights

Mr.Rutkowski waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--no demand for speedy trial

Atty. Olsen requests a plea/sentencing be scheduled.

Case called at 3:11 pm [sf]
Defendant Jeremy M. Rutkowski in court with Attorney Nicole Nannette Schrier and Attorney Daniel Olsen. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews procedural posture of the case.
Attorney Olsen appoligized that he should have prepared a substitution of attorney.
Defendant advises that this is his request for the substitution.
Court relieves Attorney Schrier of her appointment, she may submitt her final bill.
Court and defendant discuss if there was an order for repayment, first payemtn is due 3/22/16.
Court verifies DOB and address with defendant.
Court reviews criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties reading waived
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties.  

Court requires a $1000 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No contact with Eddie Hudson
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Damien Bakken

reconvene: 3:18 pm

Consent to Act as Court appointed Attorney signed by Attorney Schrier
Attorney Nicole Schrier is appointed. Repayment at the arate of $200 per month until the total sum is paid. The first payment shall be made on 3-2-16. Payments shall be made to the Clerk of Court.
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.

Court's response to letter from defendant dated 1/24/16 and received 1/25/16. The Code of Judicial Ethics in SCR 60.01(10) prohibits a Judge from receiving communications outside of court from one party unless it is clear that a photocopy of such communications has been provided to all other parties simultaneously. The Court has forwarded a courtesy copy this time to the DA.
